title: BEN WEBSTER business card sans serif id
content:
Looking for an ID on the font used for BEN WEBSTER. many thanks in advance,  
danny

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090507185558im_/http:/typophile.com/files/BWEB_3424.jpg)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [BWEB.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20090507185558/http:/typophile.com/files/BWEB.jpg) | 272.9 KB |
author: SKUMATIK

comments.content:
Could be Century Old Style (because of straight R), or Bruce Old Style. There might be others, but based on what I can see in the sample, these are my guesses. Century is the top sample.

- Mike Yanega

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090507185558im_/http:/typophile.com/files/century_os_full_3416.gif)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090507185558im_/http:/typophile.com/files/bruceoldstyle_bt_full_4469.gif)

Looking at them this way, I can see the Century numeral 9 is wrong.

- Mike Yanega
bruce looks pretty close, i think i’m gonna go with that. thanks mike!

I was thinking it should be a metal type in order to be pressed into the card that way. I was looking for typefaces that would still be fairly common in metal.

- Mike Yanega

Closest I could find is Century Old Style, but it’s lacking some characteristics that Hoefler Text has as well.

It also looks like this was done from plates rather than handset, so it could be anything.
No idea, but that’s one damn fine business card.
